analysis: The webpage provides instructions on installing Dubbo on an openEuler system, but does not provide specific information on installing or building the project on a Debian/Ubuntu Linux system.
The webpage does not provide specific instructions for installing or building the project 'dubbo' on a Debian/Ubuntu Linux system from source code.
The webpage does not provide specific instructions for building the 'dubbo' project from source on a Debian/Ubuntu Linux system.

The webpage provides instructions on how to build the 'dubbo' project from source code on a Debian/Ubuntu Linux system. Here are the relevant steps and requirements:

Requirements:
- Java version above 1.8
- Maven version 2.2.1 or above
- The following MAVEN_OPTS should be configured before building:
  export MAVEN_OPTS=-Xmx1024m -XX:MaxPermSize=512m

Steps to build from source:
1. Clone the project source code:
   ```
   git clone https://github.com/apache/dubbo.git dubbo
   ```

2. Build the project with Maven:
   ```
   mvn clean install
   ```

3. Skip testing during the build:
   ```
   mvn install -Dmaven.test.skip
   ```

4. Build the jar package of the source code:
   ```
   mvn clean source:jar install -Dmaven.test.skip
   ```

5. Modify the dubbo dependency in your sample project to the SNAPSHOT version of the local repository.

Additionally, the page provides instructions on how to set up the project in IntelliJ IDEA and Eclipse for IDE support and debugging. No specific instructions for Debian/Ubuntu Linux system were provided.
The provided webpage does not contain specific instructions for installing or building the 'dubbo' project on a Debian/Ubuntu Linux system from source code.
